column4: hello, i have a problem with nvidia after upgrading to 9.10... tried everything and gdm crush... some help plz ?
u did a clean install?
yup
i have nvidia 190, all installed clean, rm -rf /etc/X11/xorg.conf nvidia-settings
it must have automatically detected the drivers?
rosemary-  i dont know, i tried to get in "hardware drivers" and it doesnt there
i too hv nvidia
rosemary-  i googled my problem and theres no answer in web
u have any drivers installed for it now?
ActionParsnip1-  i tried 180, 173 everything
rosemary-  yes, the 190 drivers
190 is beta
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation NV17 [GeForce4 MX 440] (rev a3)
rosemary-  im telling you i tried also 180, 173 same shit
ActionParsnip1-  offcours
do u any listed in hardware drivers as off now?
sponix-  so you say i need to remove all the nvidia-glx shit and just use the default xorg nv
doesn't it automatically prompt 2 enable drivers?
did it ever prompt to to install drivers?
sponix-  ok i'll try the 96 as you said, and if it doesnt work i use nuffin
rosemary-  no... i just like to be updated :D
it good to be updated. but it has to work na ;)
